synopsis:
Urobe was a son of the great chief of Pyrimi, Africa. One day he hung on an airplane and came to Japan. Because of the cold and hunger, he fell on to the yard of Shishioâ€™s house, and Shishio nursed him. Kurobe was very thankful for him and began to repay for his kindness. Kurobe dug a big hole in the yard. Every time he returns the favor, he threw a stone into the hole until stones would fill the hole.

(Source: ANN)
